item.title: Queensland COVID-19 cluster grows
item.description: Nine new locations across Queensland’s southeast have been added to an extensive COVID-19 contact tracing list as pressure over the state’s border closure reaches boiling point.

item.title: ‘Disgusting’ schoolgirl attack on video
item.description: A vicious daylight attack between two female students in their school uniforms has been widely condemned after it circulated on social media.

item.title: Alleged knifeman’s chilling threat
item.description: The man accused of launching a bloody knife-attack on police officers in Sydney’s CBD on Wednesday allegedly muttered “Allahu Akbar” after his arrest.

item.title: Pair fight for life after freeway crash
item.description: Two people are fighting for life after a serious single-car crash on Melbourne’s Eastern Freeway overnight.

item.title: Man’s lewd sex act in front of girls: cops
item.description: Two teenage girls have been left terrified after they were allegedly followed down a laneway by an unknown man in Sydney’s inner west earlier this week.

item.title: Millions in funding for virus vaccine hope
item.description: More than $10 million will be invested in Australian researchers, including those hunting for a vaccine and lifesaving treatment for COVID-19.

item.title: Miner to cut emissions by 400,000 cars
item.description: BHP says it will reduce emissions from electricity consumption at its Queensland coal mines by 50 per cent over the next five years.

item.title: Hotel guard sacked after hitting on guest
item.description: A 19-year-old security guard was sacked after he asked a hotel guest if she wanted to go out for coffee after quarantine, an inquiry has heard.

item.title: Murder accused told cops: ‘I was very scared’
item.description: A Supreme Court jury has been shown video of accused murderer Caroline Dela Rose Nilsson laying in a hospital bed and wearing a neck brace, recounting details of the night her mother-in-law died.

item.title: Tragic refugee’s final plea for help
item.description: An asylum seeker on Nauru who set himself on fire had asked for psychological help before self-immolating, a court was told.
